alert.note: Alert for Houston (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 12 at 11:34PM CDT until April 13 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WINONA...WESTERN HOUSTON AND EASTERN FILLMORE COUNTIES... At 1134 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near St. Charles to near Rushford to near Canton, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Rushford and Lewiston around 1140 PM CDT. Stockton around 1145 PM CDT. Winona and Goodview around 1150 PM CDT. Spring Grove around 1155 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Choice, County Roads 6 And 33, Wyattville, Isinours, Hutton, Riceford and Utica. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 233 and 253. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern Iowa...and southeastern Minnesota. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
